title: Weather update: Heavy rains likely in Assam, Maharashtra. Yellow alert in Delhi, orange in Kerala - CNBC TV18
text: 3 Min Read The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted intermittent showers until August 5 in parts of Delhi. The IMD also issued a yellow alert for light to moderate rain on August 2. Early Friday morning, parts of the national capital experienced light rainfall. The weather department also issued an orange alert for four districts of Kerala — Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur, and Kasaragod — until Saturday (August 3). Apart from the aforementioned districts, a yellow alert has been issued for Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Ernakulam, Idukki, Thrissur, Palakkad, and Malappuram. All educational institutions will remain closed on August 2 in several districts of Kerala such as Wayanad, Thrissur, Malappuram, Kozhikode, Kannur, Kasragod, and Palakkad. Neetha K Gopal, IMD Kerala director, said, "We have issued an orange alert in four northern districts of Kerala, including Wayanad. In the south, up to Pathanamthitta, we have also issued a yellow alert. From tomorrow on, there will be a considerable reduction in rainfall activity. So the yellow alerts are being confirmed only for the northern districts of Kerala. And then from Sunday there will be a reduction, and we will be experiencing only light to moderate rain thereafter for another four days." Regional Forecast: West and Central India According to the IMD bulletin, widespread light to moderate rainfall, thunderstorms, and lightning are expected for the next five days in the region. Isolated extremely heavy rainfall is likely in Madhya Maharashtra, East Madhya Pradesh, on August 2 and 3, and Konkan, Goa, West Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat Region on August 3. Konkan, Goa, Madhya Maharashtra, and Gujarat Region are likely to receive heavy rainfall from August 2–7; Madhya Pradesh from August 2-4; Vidarbha and Chhattisgarh on August 2 and 3; and Saurashtra and Kutch on August 3. Northwest India Widespread light to moderate rainfall, thunderstorms, and lightning are expected over Jammu-Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand, and scattered to fairly widespread rainfall is expected over Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, and Rajasthan during the week. Isolated very heavy rainfall likely in Uttarakhand on August 2 and 3, East Rajasthan during August 2-4, Jammu-Kashmir and Rajasthan during August 2-6, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand during August 2-8, Uttar Pradesh during August 2 and 3, and August 6-8. South Peninsular India Widespread light to moderate rainfall is expected in Coastal Karnataka, Lakshadweep, Kerala, Mahe, and Karnataka, with isolated to scattered rainfall in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karaikal, Coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam, Telangana, and Rayalaseema during the next five days. East and Northeast India Widespread light to moderate rainfall, accompanied by thunderstorms, and lightning, is expected for the next five days over East and Northeast India. It also predicted very heavy rainfall at isolated places over Assam and Meghalaya on August 2 and Sub-Himalayan West Bengal and Sikkim on August 5. Isolated heavy rainfall is very likely over Jharkhand, Odisha, Gangetic West Bengal on August 2, Bihar, Assam, Meghalaya, Sub-Himalayan West Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura during August 2-8.
